page.title: 13ALL SAINT'S CHURCH
page.content:
The Church at Souldrop falls in the parish of Knotting and Souldrop and is administered by the vicar of Sharnbrook. {Morning services}are held every Sunday at 9am when communion is usually celebrated. There is an afternoon service every fourth Sunday in the month. In the days when it was an estate village, everyone was expected to go, but{attendance}now is usually only about 17 to 20 people. (The car and television have altered village life considerably in recent years - there is not the same community feeling.)
The church tower dates from the 13th century. The Church was rebuilt in 1861 and re-opened on Trinity Sunday. {Feast Sunday}was a major village event held for many years on Trinity Sunday.
